block.p: Widespread fears after Sept. 11 that the economy would fall into deep recession have not been realized. Instead, a mild recession appears to have ended near the end of last year, thanks largely to the resilience of consumers and a surge in government spending. But growth remains meager, with businesses reluctant to invest in new equipment, and a few sectors, including airlines, still suffering greatly.
